page.title: 16GOVERNMENT IN FRILSHAM
page.content: People in Frilsham are{law abiding. There is very little vandalism. What there is could be the work of youngsters from outside the area. There are few problems for their policeman who comes from Bucklebury and drives round in a patrol car. The {Parish Council}has 6 members and meets bi-monthly in the village hall. The chairman is often a farmer as befits a predominately farming community. Associated with it are two{charities administered by councillors. The Dean Pocock Charity provides 40 parcels at Christmas for elderly residents. The Haywards Charity gives money for books and education. These monies are derived from legacies made by former residents of Frilsham.The Parish Council meets no serious problems. Today's MP is a member of the Conservative party.
